de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api.elements

Class MSlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.impl.elements.IElementImpl
      • de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api.elements.MSlot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IElement, IInventory<MSlot>, org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable

    public final class MSlot
extends IElementImpl
implements IInventory<MSlot>
    This is a menu element that behaves like a regular inventory slot. Depending on some rules this slot may ba taken by the player or something may be put into this slot.
    In Book UIs this element can not be interacted with.

      MSlot()

      • fireSlotChangeEvent

        public void fireSlotChangeEvent(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer,
                                SlotChange change)
        Description copied from interface: IInventory
        Called by the renderer to inform the element that the slot has changed.
        This method has to be implemented by the IElement implementation.
        Specified by:
        fireSlotChangeEvent in interface IInventory<MSlot>
        Parameters:
        viewer - the viewer that caused the slot change / is currently viewing this element
        change - the simplified SlotChange object containing more information

      • getSlotChangeListener

        public OnSlotChangeListener<MSlot> getSlotChangeListener()
        Specified by:
        getSlotChangeListener in interface IInventory<MSlot>
        Returns:
        The currently assigned slot change listener used when firing a slot change, or null if unset

      • getAccess

        public int getAccess()
        This field defined whether the items in this slot of the GUI can be taken by a player or placed by one. This returns a logical combination of the GUI_ACCESS_* values.
        Default value for InventoryElements = GUI_ACCESS_PUT|GUI_ACCESS_TAKE, otherwise GUI_ACCESS_NONE
        Specified by:
        getAccess in interface IElement
        Returns:
        the inventory access permissions for this element

      • setAccess

        public void setAccess(int slotAccess)
        Set the access to this slot according to a logic combination of GUI_ACCESS_* values.
        See getAccess() for more information.
        Parameters:
        slotAccess - new added access permissions

      • getIcon

        public IIcon getIcon(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        If you intend to display this element in a inventory menu this should return a IIcon. These are possibly animated ItemStackSnapshots. If null is returned the slot will be rendered empty, this means no interaction is possible.
        Specified by:
        getIcon in interface IElement
        Parameters:
        viewer - The viewer this icon is currently rendered for.

      • getName

        public org.spongepowered.api.text.Text getName(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        For GUI rendering this replaces the item name of the icon and is optional, for Text rendering this equals the textual representation.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface IElement
        Returns:
        the Text to display instead of the Item name, or null, if the icon shall specify

      • getLore

        public java.util.List<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text> getLore(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player viewer)
        Description copied from interface: IElement

        Specified by:
        getLore in interface IElement
        Returns:
        the Lore to display instead if the items one, or null, if the icon shall specify

      • copy

        public MSlot copy()
        Description copied from interface: IElement
        It is quicker for the elements to implement this method, than to use reflection to determine field to copy. Example: A Button extends IElement should implement this as 
         public Button copy() {
   Button copy = new Button(...);
   ... // element specific values to copy
   return copy;
 }
        Specified by:
        copy in interface IElement
        Returns:
        a copy of this element with the same values
